explanation: formal; to catch and arrest someone who has not obeyed the law
sentence: The police have finally apprehended the killer.
sentence_gap: The police have finally ___________ the killer.

explanation: a bright yellow metal made from copper and zinc
sentence: The door handles were made of brass.
sentence_gap: The door handles were made of _____.

explanation: to officially make something holy and able to be used for religious ceremonies
sentence: The new cathedral was completed and consecrated in 2002.
sentence_gap: The new cathedral was completed and ___________ in 2002.

explanation: formal; (of difficulties, problems, etc.) that cannot be dealt with successfully
sentence: This small country is faced with an insurmountable debt.
sentence_gap: This small country is faced with an ______________ debt.

explanation: formal; extremely unpleasant and causing or deserving hate
sentence: By making religion hard it made it odious, and thus prepared the way for unbelief.
sentence_gap: By making religion hard it made it ______, and thus prepared the way for unbelief.

explanation: suggesting that something unpleasant is likely to happen
sentence: There was an ominous silence when I asked whether my contract was going to be renewed.
sentence_gap: There was an _______ silence when I asked whether my contract was going to be renewed.

explanation: to suddenly move towards a person or animal that you want to catch
sentence: The cat sat in the tree ready to pounce on the ducks below.
sentence_gap: The cat sat in the tree ready to ______ on the ducks below.

explanation: formal; payment for work or services
sentence: They demanded adequate remuneration for their work.
sentence_gap: They demanded adequate ____________ for their work.

explanation: formal; to tell someone that you do not approve of something that they have done
sentence: The teacher gently reproved the boys for not paying attention.
sentence_gap: The teacher gently ________ the boys for not paying attention.

explanation: the material that covers chairs and other types of seats
sentence: The car had been shut up long enough that it smelled of old upholstery.
sentence_gap: The car had been shut up long enough that it smelled of old __________.
